reviewText: Received this movie in just a couple of dys after I ordered it and was throughly satisfied with both the movie and the seller.

This is a well done, well written movie about finding Love and having a second chance to redeem it.  My family will enjoy this story for many years.

Linda
I was really surpised on how this movie was so different-To go back in time & change your life, was really unpredictable. It was just great!!!

For anyone who has ever longed for a second chance with the one they "gave away".....for anyone who has ever wished they could go back and do something over in a different way...have that second chance to say things that went unsaid or maybe to try and say them better...or even just the urge to re-experience a special point in time when "feeling" was what life was all about, this movie should be right up your alley.

It is a sweet and charming little love story that i have actually watched a few times.......and still like it!

I must say I enjoyed this movie very much.  It is a retrospective of Eve's

choices.  Sometimes an individual looks back on a situation wishing that they could reexamine a decision.  This movie is a fine example that Christmas is a magical time.  That a person can get what they wish for.

Eve looks for happiness in New York, but she has to go home to Oregon and the road lest traveled.  She finds happiness with Scott by making her Christmas wish.

Maureen McElroy
very heartwarming to see someone get a second chance from a terrible mistake she made the first time. she almost makes the same mistake, but love conquers all.

I was afraid this movie was going to be a career versus family story.  It isn't.  It's a career-only versus career-with-family story.  It seems to be speaking to those who feel that the decision to get married and have a family means giving up their dreams, setting low goals and having low expectations.  This movie shows that you don't have to do it that way.  You can get married, have a family and still strive to make something of your life.  It does not show that it may (or may not) be harder that way, but the point is made.

If you want a career versus family movie, the best is "Me, Myself, I" (NO, not "Me, Myself and Irene").  This is an intelligent Australian movie that shows that both choices come with a price, both have their advantages and disadvantages.  The movie stars Rachel Griffiths and is powerful, if sobering.

Eve's Christmas is not really a Christmas movie, but a story set at Christmas time, which is appropriate since thoughts of family and old friends tend to occur at this time of the year.

To take on our local "experts": the script is no "weaker" than most other movie scripts, and the acting is competent.  The first half of the movie could have been more eventful but is not slow.  The lead actress could have been better cast, but this one does not hurt the movie.

Bottom line: an enjoyable feel-good movie, quite realistic (unless you've never seen a happy family and don't believe they exist).

I'm a sucker for anything Christmas. I generally have decent taste in movies the rest of the year, but come Christmas-time, I lap up these sappy movies. But even I couldn't stomach this one. The screenplay and the acting were so pathetic that the entire time I was watching it I wondered if this was made as a result of a bet that a Christmas movie could be written and shot in 3 days that suckers like me would buy. What a waste of money & time!

"Eve's Christmas" is a TV movie with a very weak script, that is valiantly held together by a good cast, and a nice "second chance in life" plot. Eve is a top New York ad agency gal, making lots of money and a mess out of her life. She is having an affair with her licentious married boss, and left alone on Christmas Eve, has far too much to drink (the libations run like a river in this film). She reflects over the last few years of her empty existence, which have been cut off from her family, and very lonely. A guardian angel, disguised as a panhandler, tells her to wish upon a star, and she is granted a week to go back in time and make different choices.

Elisa Donovan plays Eve, and is fine in the role, but it's a difficult part to be convincing in, as she is the sophisticated New Yorker, but at the same time the girl back home, about to get married, working in a coffee shop. Cheryl Ladd shines as her mother, and also excellent are Winston Reckert as her father, Erin Karpluck as her friend Mandy, and Peter Williams as the guardian angel, Brother James. Best of all is Sebastian Spence as Scott, the man she almost married. His charismatic smile and good looks, as well as his talent, make me wonder why he is not more well known as an actor, and not the current heart-throb on the magazine covers.

Directed by Timothy Bond, a veteran of many TV films, "Eve's Christmas" is a charming romantic fantasy despite its many flaws (the bridal shop scenes make no sense at all, and are simply horrible), and if one doesn't have high expectations, this unpretentious little film is quite entertaining. The total running time is 96 minutes, and the DVD extras include a "Behind the Scenes Featurette."
Pretty good Christmas movie
Great Christmas movie!  I had it on my DVR but wanted to own it.  It was pricey, but I'm glad I have it!

The movie gave me smiles and tears --only the Special ones can do that!  Nice film for Romance and inspiring Hope.  Love those movies of 'going back in time', but for those of us who wake up to the same surroundings, the new day can bring a new future.  Enjoy!

This movie resembles several made for Christmas, which include THE FAMILY MAN, COMFORT AND JOY, and even IT'S A WONDERFUL LIFE. It centers on a selfish and vain young woman who some years back had renounced a more sentimental and provincial life out west for the sophistication of life in NYC as an advertising executive. When she runs into her "guardian angel," he has more than a small surprise for her on Christmas Eve!
This is fun, going back in time to try to make your present life better.
loved this movie. good price. quick delivery. good add to my collection
Love this Holiday  movie.
enjoy
Love this movie. Especially for the holidays.
This is such a good movie.  I watch it 3-5 days a week.  I love christmas movies, but this is my favorite by far.
The DVD was in great condition.
It was expensive for the condition.
this movie came in when it said it would, and work great. This movie will have you rethink about some of the choise that you have made in your life.
Great holiday movie to enjoy with the entire family.  I love these movies and collect as many as I can.  The goodhearted movies are those that live forever. Can't wait to watch again next year.

A lighthearted, imaginative movie with an enjoyable cast.  Another holiday movie we watch every year. Eve went back in time with the help of an angel? to relive a turning point in her life.  Will she make different choices this time?  Tune in to find out.

It's 2004 and Eve Simon (Eliza Donovan) faces another lonely holiday in New York. Eight years on the grind at her marketing firm, Eve's kept her eyes on the prize, she's scaled that corporate ladder. She's nearly at the top rung. But, tonight, she's at a low ebb. It's not been a good day. Her mind wanders back to that long ago moment when she chose career over love. Estranged from her family, pining for a lost romance, she makes a whimsical wish upon a star. Sometimes, when you do such things during Christmas, you get more than you bargained for. Eve Simon awakens in 1996 in her sleepy hometown of Eastborough, Oregon, mere days away from her Christmas day wedding. Naturally, Eve is perplexed and halfway suspects that she's being punked, but she rolls with it. Let's sit back and watch Eve relive those days when she'd just finished grad school and was managing a coffee shop (today, she loathes coffee). We learn all over again that hindsight is 20/20. In her second chance Eve indulges in a bit of matchmaking, spruces up her then fianc's flagging book store, hangs out with Mandy (Erin Karpluk), the one constant friend in her life, and I think I just skipped over Eve's love interest, my bad. Scott Gustafson (Sebastian Spence), Eve's intended, has got that stout Viking name, so it's too bad that he doesn't register much on my radar, although he seems like a sweet guy. In 1996, he spends most of the time being non-plussed at how Eve's been acting so strange of late. Eve's Christmas is a slice of small town life and refutes that old saw about the grass being greener on the other side. In 2004, on that lonely Christmas eve, Eve reflects that the grass on that old side was really quite verdant and- never mind, I'm wasting imaginary ink stretching this metaphor. What we have in this movie is Eve's re-experiencing those everyday moments that, for her, add up to what defines home and contentment and, ultimately, herself as the person she wants to be. Watching this movie is like putting on an old pair of pajamas, nothing exciting, but there's a gratifying comfort level. Cheryl Ladd (my second favorite Angel) has a supporting part as Eve's understanding mom, and she's as lovely as ever. In the annals of altered reality/time travel romantic films, it plays very much in the pocket. It's not as good as Peggy Sue Got Married (1986) or The Family Man (2000). It's certainly not as sweepingly romantic as Somewhere in Time (Collector's Edition), but, hey, this is a made-for-television heart-warmer so the production values tend towards the more modest. I like it just as much as I did other television pictures: A Family Thanksgiving (2010) and Comfort and Joy (2003). Plus, Winky's, that watering hole/diner/karaoke bar in Eastborough, looks like a fun place to hang. 3.5 out of 5 stars for Eve's Christmas. Note that my favorite acting in this film is done by the lively Erin Karpluk as Eve's best friend in both past and present. I only wish there was an "N" in that surname. If you were scratching your head about the review title, the traffic light as a wish fulfillment device is from Before You Say I Do, a terrific TV film in this genre and one I should've mentioned before. I'm assuming you know where the DeLorean reference comes from.
When I feel down and out I watch this movie and remember there is always a second chance to live life the way it should be lived.

The reviews on this movie are a bit unfair, as this is not an Oscar-nominated type of film, but a light, "feel good" movie with fairly good cast.  I enjoyed it very much and it was a cute story to watch during the holiday season.

This movie is delightful as every once in a while, it is great to get lost in the aspect of a time travel movie.  This one allows the person to go back and change things for the better.  This is one on my list of repeats for all year round.  Very nice escape for less than two hours, if you enjoy feel good movies.
The movie was great and I like the Fact  that her home State is Oregon and the actress birthday is on mine.  The movie is GREAT
this is my movie to because it around x-mas time I get to enjoy it at alltime to my older daughter like it to
I bought this as a xmas gift for my sister as she is a movie lover and this movie was at the top of her movie list that she wanted for xmas.

I liked the acting  and the story was very good but
there is too much drinking in it for me.

I loved this movie.  That is why I ordered it.  It will give me pleasure for many years to come.
We need more movies like this.
This is one of our family's favorite Christmas shows.  It a fun light hearted show that will make you smile.
Everyone wonders whether they took the right or wrong road in life.  This movie allows Eve to go back in time to try another road.  Just loved this movie since the first time I saw it.
I've been looking for this movie for a good while.  Saw it when it first came out on the Halmark channel.  Was happy to find it's still as entertaining as I remembered.
This is one of my favorite Christmas movies!  I watch it every year each and every time it comes on TV!  I figured I may as well purchase it LOL!
I love the movie. Its one of my favorites. Thanks again for delivering it in a timely fashion. I can watch the movie over & over
Have loved this movie for a few years now. So happy to own it now. A great feel good movie!

Elisa Donovan does a great job with the story. This is my very favorite of all the new Christmas movies that are available. I love all the old movies as well but I watch this one several times each Christmas season!

I really like thwe movie and it got here real fast thank you I have all ready watched 6 times and I will watch it again Friday Happy ThanksGiving to you all

  Candy
Don't waste your time on this movie. Bought it because it is a Hallmark movie and it is lousy. the girl is an avid drinker in the movie and it just didn't follow the typical Hallmark movie themes.

I liked this Movie A lot when it first came out! She left home and her fiancee (Sebastian Spence) on their wedding day many years before to pursue a job as a well paid Ad executive in a big city! Seemingly doing very well, and having a romance with her snake of a married Boss! But, she isn't happy since something is missing from her life! (LOVE) As with a lot of Christmas movies it has the "Angel" who grants her one wish upon the "Christmas Star" and a chance to go back and re-do her mistakes! It's cute and of course being a "Feel good Movie" she makes the right choice the second time around but not quite as easy as you think! What it does have is a twist ending and I won't spoil it for anyone who hasn't seen it yet, but I'm glad they added it! If your like me, and have a stock pile of Holiday/Christmas DVDs, you won't regret adding this one to your library!

I have watched this movie every year at Christmas since it came out.  It's about a woman who has an affair with her boss and is disappointed that they won't be spending Christmas together.  It is then that she regrets the decisions she has made in her life and wishes she could go back and do things differently.  She gets her wish and the adventure begins!  I recommend this movie highly!
"Peggy Sue Got Married" meets "It's A Wonderful Life"....Very cute, Hallmark-type Christmas movie.  Nothing deep or serious about this film, but it's cute and enjoyable light-hearted Christmas fun!

The title for my review says it all.  This is a feel good movie.  Eve's Christmas if a different take on the "It's A Wonderful Life" story.  Eve is a Executive Assistant and unhappy with her life and some of the choices she's made.  In pops her Guardian Angel who gives her the opportunity to change a decision she made when she was young.  Eve has the opportunity to relive the time during which she made this fateful choice.  It may not be the strongest script nor the best acting I've seen, but it is a heartwarming, nostalgic movie.  After all it is a Christmas movie and a fantasy.  I liked this movie and bought it because it makes me feel good when I watch it.  I believe that says it all.
when i recived this item it was broken so the only thing i can say is the cover was nice
A cute fun movie. clean and no dirty language. its well acted. enjoyable. I kept it to watch at holiday time with friends and family.
I love this movie.  Such a lovely message while giving giggles throughout.  It's a must-see for me every year so I decided I needed to just buy it for myself!

i thought the movie was terrific and the story line exciting
and how eve was able to start her life over again. too bad you
can't do that in real life, oh well.

I really liked this movie. Yes it was another corny Christmas movie and I read some other reviews that said the story is unrealistic, but that is the purpose it's only a movie. A million people would love to have a chance to go back in time at some point in their life and make thing's different just like Eve did. The purpose of the story is that money isn't everything and that family is so very important. Eve had a terrific Pennhouse in NY City, and she was a top executive for her company making 150,000 plus a year, however it all went for nothing because she was single with the exception of sleeping with her boss who was seperated with kids and only hired pretty intern girls. Eve was overworked and turned to drinking because her only friend was her secretary and she had no family at all. She realized this was not the life she wanted and that she wanted to go back 8 years prior and complete a Christmas day wedding she cancelled by accepting the job offer in NY. It was kind of sad, but I enjoyed watching the movie even though it was a corny lifetime movie. Elisa Donovan did a great job.
I couldn't rent this so I bought from Amazon. It is avery good holiday film. I watch every year now while I wrap gifts.
If you like the romantic genre of Christmas shows, that are pure entertainment, then i recommend this.  Very enjoyable, loved all the characters.

What a delightful holiday movie. Love Elisa Donovan, Cheryl Ladd, Sebastian Spence and all the others. The theme of this for me was be grateful for what you have and had in your life for if you move in haste the choices you make may or may not be what are for your highest good.

I have read mixed reviews about this movie but I really enjoyed it.  I've seen it a number of times and I continue to find it entertaining.  I was never a big Elisa Donavan fan prior to this but after this movie, I actually grew to like her very much.  There are some funny things in the movie that  I chuckle at----like the fact that this is set 10 years ago (10 years ago from point of filming which was 2004, so 1994)  and supposedly Eve can create a working website overnight and sell things over the internet the next morning, linking the store's inventory up, etc.  Humm......I don't think it was quite that easy in 1994 but I'm no IT expert.  Overall, I think this movie is very enjoyable for the holiday season and I do recommend it to anyone that likes a good "chick-flick."
This is a truely wonderful Christmas movie where a girl gets a second chance at happiness.  You will enjoy this one.

I was disappointed with this movie.  My best advice is rent the movie and be your own judge.  If you like it, buy it.  If I had doen this, I would never have wasted money for this.  It just wasn't a well written script.

The movie, Eve's Christmas was an entertaining movie, if not a great one.  However, I had recently discovered Sebastian Spence in the Hallmark movie, Daniel's Daughter. He is really such a consumate actor. And, his involvement in this movie is basically the reason I ordered it.

Imagine a female Scrooge, all driven to succeed and having an affair with her married boss.  She broke up with her long-time fiance to take this job in the big city.  She hasn't seen her brother or parents since her departure.  She finds herself alone on Christmas Eve.  She makes a Christmas wish and wakes up to find herself back before she was offered the job, days before her wedding.  She realizes she loves her fiance and she fights with the need for success.  The ending is a very happy one.

This is one of the cutest Christmas movies we watch every year. My family was very disappointed that it wasn't on this year. Too many new movies were repeated and good, familiar movies were bumped out.....big mistake!!!!! Eves Christmas, The Christmas List with Mimi Rogers, Ebby.....WONDERFUL movies that weren't on this year. Such a let down Hallmark, bad move!

This is an excellent movie about a woman who gets to go back in time to the few days before her wedding. I always wanted to buy this movie, but it is now rather expensive. Anyway, I recommend it for anyone who loves Christmas movies.
this was a great movie

Cute as a fantacy .  Stretches your imagination, but a good light-hearted movie where the girl gets her man while "time traveling".  Good for those who wonder back-in-time to "what if??"
